title: Tomoe-gozen
text: Tomoe-gozen was a female samurai warrior from the late 12th century, admired for her beauty and fighting skills. She holds a halberd-like weapon in her left hand called a naginata, the predominant weapon for fighting on a horse.
description: female warior riding on white horse; front 3/4 of horse visible
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
